channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I am physically and mentally healthy’: I’m a 66-year-old retiree. Should I wait until after the election before investing $300,000 in stocks?
item.description: “I have most of my expenses covered.”

item.title: Markets set for rally after U.S. elections, Barclays says
item.description: Markets will likely experience a ‘mild relief rally’ in the wake of the vote as a smooth transition starts to come into sight

item.title: The financial pressures facing some swing state voters: ‘We can’t afford to live’
item.description: The higher cost of essential expenses like rent, child care and food have emerged as a defining issue of the 2024 election, but the economic consequen...

item.title: Oil Slides More Than 4% After Israel's Attack Spared Iranian Oil Facilities
item.description: Oil prices fell more than 4% in early European trade after Israel’s strike at Iran over the weekend steered clear of oil and nuclear facilities, signa...

item.title: Gold Futures Fall as Safe-Haven Demand Damped, Dollar Gains
item.description: Gold futures slipped and Pepperstone said Israel’s retaliation against Iran seems relatively limited, and tensions could begin to subside in the short...

item.title: There’s a ‘generational opportunity’ for investors in this sector, says JPMorgan
item.description: Look to real estate as stocks’ high valuations means they may not offer great returns in coming years

item.title: Helen Mirren’s L.A. home has a star-studded history; she just relisted it for the third time, now for $15 million
item.description: Mirren bought the estate in the 1980s. Hollywood history buffs will be intrigued to learn of the property’s background.

item.title: Dollar Rises Further Due to U.S. Economic Strength, Ahead of Election
item.description: The dollar rose to its highest in three months against a basket of currencies and the trend looks likely to continue, ING said, as evidence of U.S. ec...

item.title: Their Car Is Totaled, but They Still Owe Years of Payments
item.description: Roughly a third of people who financed cars owe more than their vehicles are worth, which can be consequential once they get rid of the car.

item.title: Why Apple's AI Success Hinges on the iPhone
item.description: Big tech rivals can distribute AI widely through their services, while Apple’s hardware-centric business needs its devices as the touchpoint.
